intro: Mikania cristata, commonly known as the crowned mikania, is a flowering plant native to the Americas. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and opposite leaf arrangement. The plant typically grows as a climbing vine with hairy stems and heart-shaped leaves. Its small yellow flowers are clustered in dense inflorescences, and it is often found in moist, disturbed habitats. Mikania cristata is known for its rapid growth and is sometimes considered a weed in agricultural areas.
